Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY Tanza Campus Ph. 2, Bahay Katuparan, Bagtas, Tanza, Cavite (046) 414-3979 www.cvsu.edu.ph
OFFICE OF STUDENT AFFAIRS AND SERVICES
September 16, 2022
PROF. GIL D. RAMOS Campus Administrator This University
Dear Sir:
The University will be holding the 2022 Cultural and the Arts Festival on October 5, 2022 at the University International Convention Center. As part of our participation on the said activity, we are asking your good office to allow us to conduct an in-person screening for the participants on September 26, 2022.
Attached is the list of events and prospected participants. Looking for your approval on this activity. Thank you and stay safe!
Respectfully yours,
MELONA I. SAQUIN Head, OSAS
Approved:
GIL D. RAMOS, MAHisto Campus Administrator

Dear Sir:

Respectfully yours,
RITCH M. BANATE NSTP Coordinator

Approved:

Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY TANZA ǀ Trece Martires City ǀ Gen. Trias City Campus  414 – 3979 ǀ  410-5247 ǀ 437-0693 www.cvsu.edu.ph
CIRCLE OF POTENTIAL EDUCATORS November 16, 2021
PROF. GIL D. RAMOS Campus Administrator CvSU – Tanza Campus
Dear Prof. Ramos:
The Circle of Potential Educators (CoPE) would like to request permission from your good office on the conduct of Engaging ICT Development and Understanding multi- Cultural Education (EDUC) Congress: The New Normal on December 2 – 3, 2021. This activity aims to provide our teacher education students, both from BEE and BSE programs, meaningful activities relative to the works of an in-service teachers, such as instructional materials development, lesson planning activity, demonstration teaching, and test and TOS construction to prepare them in planning, monitoring, assessing, and reporting learning processes and outcomes.
Webinar on ICT, mental health and multilingual education and Academic Contests will highlight this year’s two-day EDUC Congress.
This activity will be done with the help of the instructors from Teacher Education Department in facilitating and evaluating the Academic Contests.
Attached is the activity proposal for your reference.
It is hoped that this request merits your most favorable consideration.
Thank you very much.
Very truly yours,
MA. WOODELYN P. REYES CoPE President
Noted by:
MILDRED A. SEBASTIAN MARIA CRISTINA C. TAGLE Senior Adviser, CoPE Junior Adviser, CoPE
Recommending Approval:
MILDRED A. SEBASTIAN MELONA I. SAQUIN Chairperson, TED Head, OSAS
Approved:
GIL D. RAMOS, MAHisto Campus Administrator

Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY TANZA ǀ Trece Martires City ǀ Gen. Trias City Campus  414 – 3979 ǀ  410-5247 ǀ 437-0693 www.cvsu.edu.ph
CIRCLE OF POTENTIAL EDUCATORS
I. Title: Engaging ICT Development and Understanding multi-Cultural Education (EDUC) Congress: The New Normal
II. Proponent: Circle of Potential Educators
III. Rationale: The Teacher Education Department of Cavite State University – Tanza Campus provides quality education to teacher education students by conducting meaningful activities that will equip them with concrete experiences and adequate and relevant competencies to teach in their chosen area of specialization. Meaningful activities include academic competitions relative to the works of in-service teachers, such as instructional materials development, lesson planning activity, demonstration teaching, and test construction. To further determine their readiness in taking the Licensure Examination for Teachers (now Board of Licensure Examination for Professional Teachers), general and professional education quiz bee will be conducted.
The Bachelor of Elementary Education and Bachelor of Secondary Education programs both aims to facilitate learning using a wide range of teaching methodologies and delivery modes appropriate to specific learners and their environments. In this regard, this activity will also engage them into interactive discussions on how they can facilitate multilingual education considering the multiple languages, cultures and practices that are being manifested by our students. Also, they will become more involved in facilitating their learners through emerging technologies that can be utilized in presenting lessons more interactively. It is in this end that they shall be able to apply skills in the development and utilization of ICT to promote quality, relevant and sustainable educational practices.
IV. Objectives: This activity will aid our teacher education students in demonstrating a variety of thinking skills in planning, monitoring, assessing, and reporting learning processes and outcomes. Specifically, the activity aims to: 1. lead the path of teacher education students from pre-service to in-service teaching; 2. gain a deeper understanding of the nature of the 21st century learners; 3. demonstrate knowledge of the contents of professional subjects in the teacher education course; 4. develop self-confidence among contestants and sense of sportsmanship among participating teacher education students;

V. Mechanics of Implementation A. List of Participants The activity will engage all teacher education students from the Bachelor of Secondary Education and Bachelor of Elementary Education from Cavite State University – Tanza Campus.
B. Date and Venue The activity will conduct online on December 2 – 3, 2021.
C. Strategies/Mechanics 1. The activity will engage all teacher education students from the Bachelor of Secondary Education and Bachelor of Elementary Education from Cavite State University – Tanza Campus. 2. The webinars are free, obligatory and mandatory. However, students may opt to participate in the following contests:
A. Webinar i. There will be three topics for webinar: 1. Adapting, Evolving and Thriving in Remote Learning 2. Multilingual Education in the New Normal Education 3. Coping with the New Normal: Addressing the Emotional and Mental Needs of Education Students
ii. Three invited resource persons will discuss the topics. 1. Prof. Joyce Senaris 2. Prof. Noel Manarpiis 3. Ms. Farah Contessa Suzon
iii. The first two webinars will be conducted on December 2, 2021 from 8:00AM to 12:00NN at via Google meet and/or other meeting conference platforms.
iv. The last webinar will be conducted on December 3, 2021 from 8:00AM to 10:00AM.
v. Each participating student shall fill out and submit the evaluation form at the end of every webinar. This will serve as their entry for a raffle on December 3, 2021.
B. Academic Contests i. There will be five academic contests that a teacher education student may opt to participate: (1) instructional materials development, (2) lesson planning, (3) test and TOS construction, (4) demonstration teaching, and (5) general and professional education quiz bee.
1) instructional materials development, (2) lesson planning, (3) test and TOS construction, (4) demonstration teaching ii. These academic contests shall be conducted on December 2, 2021 from 1:00 PM to 6:00 PM.
iii. Each participant will be given a maximum of one hour in the preparation of IMs, lesson plan, and test and TOS construction. These will be done simultaneously online.

iv. Each participant for the demonstration teaching shall be given a maximum of 30 minutes to present his/her lesson based on the IMs developed, lesson plan written, and test constructed in the first part of the event.
General and Professional Education Quiz Bee i. The contest is open to all regular first year, second year, and third year teacher education students in Cavite State University – Tanza Campus. Student must fill out the registration form on or before the December 2, 2021.
ii. The contest will be done on December 3, 2021 from 8:00 AM to 12:00 NN.
iii. The contest questions shall be based on the following courses: Professional Education  Child and Adolescent Learning  Technology in Education  Building and Enhancing Literacy Across Curriculum  Foundations of Special and Inclusive Education  Social Dimensions of Education
General Education  Purposive Communication  The Contemporary World  Understanding the Self  Science, Technology and Society  Readings in the Philippine History  Rizal’s Life and Writings
iv. The quiz master shall present and read the question twice.
v. The contestant shall provide his/her choice of answer after the question has been read by the quiz master or immediately after the signal to do so has been given. He/She will be instructed to answer after the time limit is reached for checking purposes. All contestants shall be given only ten (10) seconds to answer each question.
vi. Each question is equivalent to one (1) point for every correct answer and zero for incorrect or no answer.
vii. The first three (3) contestants with the highest points shall be declared as winners: 1st Place, 2nd Place, and 3rd Place, respectively.
viii. The winners of Instructional materials development, lesson planning, test and TOS construction, demonstration teaching and Quiz bee will receive a printed certificate, plaque and cash prize
ix. An electronic Certificate of Participation shall be given to all participating students. D. Safety and Security Measures All of these activities will be conducted online to ensure the safety of the students, resource persons and instructors. On the other hand, winners that will claim their prizes have to wear face shield and face mask. E. Budgetary Estimate

Particulars Amount (Php) Printed Certificates and Plaque for Academic 100.00 Contest Winners
Prizes 2,500.00 st 1 Place – 200 * 5 (contest) 1000 2 Place – 150 * 5 (contest) 750 nd rd 3 Place – 100 * 5 (contest) 500 5 winners of 50 pesos Gcash load 250
Token for the Resource Persons 3,000.00 Php 1000 x 3 Resource Person
Total Projected Expenses 5,600.00
Note: The plaque will be requested from the Office of the Mayor and Prizes are from sponsorship.
VII. Contact Person (Organization President and Adviser, include contact number)
CoPE President: Ma. Woodelyn P. Reyes 09068835078 ma.woodelyn.reyes@cvsu.edu.ph
CoPE Advisers:
Mildred A. Sebastian Maria Cristina C. Tagle 09178036141 09068727389 mildred.sebastian@cvsu.edu.ph maria.tagle@cvsu.edu.ph
Respectfully,
MA. WOODELYN P. REYES President, CoPE
Noted by:
MILDRED A. SEBASTIAN MARIA CRISTINA C. TAGLE Senior Adviser, CoPE Junior Adviser, CoPE
Recommending Approval:
MILDRED A. SEBASTIAN MELONA I. SAQUIN Chairperson, TED Head, OSAS
Approved:
GIL D. RAMOS, MAHisto Campus Administrator
